content.question: The figure above shows data for actual real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and potential real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> from year <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> to year <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math> for an economy. Which of the following is true based on this figure?

choices.label: The economy is in expansion from year <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> to year <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>.
The economy is in recession from year <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> to year <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math>.
There is an inflationary gap from year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> to year <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math>.
The economy is at full employment in year <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math>.
The economy is in long-run equilibrium in year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

content.answer: The economy is in long-run equilibrium in year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

unit.text: 2: Economic Indicators and the Business Cycle

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
